snippet: Pete Carroll has put together an old-school, hard-nosed defense unit that relies on airtight man-to-man coverage in the secondary and hard knocks and no-frills pressure from the defensive front seven.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports Of The Times column praises Seattle Seahawks coach Pete Carroll for Super Bowl victory; holds that Carroll's old-school, hard-nosed team proved that defense still wins championships, even as pendulum has swung to offense in the NFL.
lead_paragraph: Pete Carroll has put together an old-school, hard-nosed defense unit that relies on airtight man-to-man coverage in the secondary and hard knocks and no-frills pressure from the defensive front seven.

headline.print_headline: A Boyish Style Works Just Fine for the Man With the League’s Best Defense
headline.main: A Boyish Style Works Just Fine for the Man With the League’s Best Defense
